intro: Hegemone, commonly known as the "queen of the forest," is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Hegemone produces small, dark-colored berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals.
